detailed_description: Persist is a JupyterLab extension that enables users to interactively manipulate data within visualizations (e.g., selection, filtering) and persist these changes back to the notebook as dataframes, bridging the gap between interactive exploration and code-based analysis.

name: jupyter_rfb
one_line_profile: Remote Frame Buffer for high-performance rendering in Jupyter
detailed_description: A widget that allows remote frame buffering for Jupyter, serving as a backend for visualization libraries like VisPy to render high-performance graphics in notebook environments.

name: Vitessce Python
one_line_profile: Python API and Jupyter widget for Vitessce spatial biology visualization
detailed_description: The Python wrapper for Vitessce, a visual integration tool for exploring spatial single-cell experiment data. It enables interactive visualization of bioimaging and genomic data directly within Jupyter notebooks.

name: Any-to-Bokeh
one_line_profile: Framework for converting videos into depth-aware bokeh effects
detailed_description: A computer vision framework that converts arbitrary input videos into temporally coherent, depth-aware bokeh effects, serving as a research implementation for image processing and computational photography tasks.

name: Voil
one_line_profile: Turns Jupyter notebooks into standalone web applications
detailed_description: Voil renders Jupyter notebooks as standalone web applications by running the notebook kernel and displaying the output, allowing scientists to share interactive dashboards and results without exposing the code.

name: VOSONDash
one_line_profile: R Shiny application for interactive network analysis
detailed_description: An interactive R Shiny dashboard for the collection and analysis of social network data, designed to work with the vosonSML package for social media analysis.

name: neighborhood_diversity
one_line_profile: Shiny application for analyzing neighborhood diversity
detailed_description: A specialized R Shiny application for visualizing and analyzing demographic diversity data across neighborhoods, serving as a tool for social science research.

name: stlite
one_line_profile: Serverless Streamlit running in the browser via WebAssembly
detailed_description: A port of Streamlit to WebAssembly, allowing scientific data applications to run entirely in the browser without a Python server, facilitating easier deployment and sharing of scientific tools.

name: streamlit-webrtc
one_line_profile: Real-time video and audio processing component for Streamlit
detailed_description: A component that enables real-time video and audio streams in Streamlit apps, widely used for deploying computer vision and audio processing models in scientific demos and tools.

name: ipyreact
one_line_profile: React integration for Jupyter widgets
detailed_description: A library that enables using React components within Jupyter widgets, providing the infrastructure to build complex, interactive scientific user interfaces and dashboards in Python.

name: ipyvue
one_line_profile: Jupyter widgets base for Vue.js libraries
detailed_description: A bridge allowing Vue.js components to be used in Jupyter notebooks, serving as a foundational library for building reactive scientific dashboards.

name: ipyvuetify
one_line_profile: Jupyter widgets based on Vuetify UI components
detailed_description: A library providing Vuetify UI components as Jupyter widgets, widely used in the scientific community (e.g., physics, astronomy) to build sophisticated control panels and dashboards.

name: reacton
one_line_profile: Pure Python port of React for ipywidgets
detailed_description: A framework that brings React-like component-based architecture to ipywidgets in pure Python, facilitating the development of complex, state-managed scientific applications in Jupyter.

name: Solara
one_line_profile: React-style framework for scaling Jupyter and Web Apps
detailed_description: A pure Python web framework that allows scientists to build scalable, reactive web applications and dashboards using a React-like API, compatible with Jupyter and standalone deployment.

name: lognplot
one_line_profile: Real-time data plotting and logging tool
detailed_description: A desktop application and library for high-performance plotting and logging of real-time data, suitable for monitoring scientific experiments or simulations.

name: DesktopDeployR
one_line_profile: Framework for deploying R-based applications to the desktop
detailed_description: A framework designed to package and deploy R-based scientific applications (like Shiny apps) as self-contained desktop software, facilitating the distribution of research tools.

name: wq
one_line_profile: Framework for mobile surveys and geospatial data collection
detailed_description: A modular framework for building offline-first mobile and web applications specifically for geospatial data collection, citizen science, and field surveys.

name: wq.app
one_line_profile: JavaScript library for wq geospatial data collection apps
detailed_description: The client-side JavaScript library for the wq framework, powering offline-first apps for field data collection and citizen science.

name: wq.db
one_line_profile: Python library for wq geospatial data collection backend
detailed_description: The server-side Python library for the wq framework, extending Django REST framework to support geospatial field data collection and crowdsourcing schemas.

name: Writer Framework
one_line_profile: Framework for creating Python-based data apps
detailed_description: An open-source framework for building data-driven applications and dashboards using Python, serving as a tool for scientists to operationalize and visualize their models and data.

name: topicwizard
one_line_profile: Interactive visualization for topic models
detailed_description: A Python library for interactive visualization and interpretation of topic models (e.g., LDA, NMF, BERTopic), aiding researchers in analyzing text corpora.

name: yfiles-jupyter-graphs
one_line_profile: Jupyter notebook graph visualization widget
detailed_description: A Jupyter widget for interactive graph and network visualization, powered by yFiles, allowing researchers to explore complex network structures within notebooks.

name: AI-DATA-VISUALIZATION-ASSISTANT
one_line_profile: AI-powered tool for creating real-time visual analytics
detailed_description: A tool leveraging AI to assist in generating data visualizations and performing visual analytics, aiming to automate parts of the scientific data exploration process.

name: faster-whisper-webui
one_line_profile: WebUI for Faster Whisper speech recognition
detailed_description: A Gradio-based web interface for the Faster Whisper model, enabling researchers to easily process audio data into text for downstream analysis.

name: Facade
one_line_profile: Autogenerated embedded live dashboards for Rust apps
detailed_description: A framework for generating embedded live dashboards for Rust applications, useful for monitoring scientific simulations or systems written in Rust.

name: Microbiome Explorer

detailed_description: The Microbiome Explorer provides methods to analyze and visualize microbial community sequencing data either from the R command line or through a Shiny application. It facilitates the exploration of microbiome data for researchers without extensive programming skills.

name: STREAM

detailed_description: A Python package designed for seamless topic modeling, evaluation, and visualization, specifically targeting text analysis and NLP research in the social sciences. It simplifies the extraction and interpretation of topics from complex datasets.

name: AutoViz
one_line_profile: Library for automatic visualization of datasets with minimal code
detailed_description: A Python library that automatically visualizes any dataset of any size with a single line of code. It performs exploratory data analysis (EDA) and generates a variety of charts to help users understand data distributions and relationships quickly.

name: bio-diffusion
one_line_profile: Geometry-complete diffusion generative model for 3D molecule generation
detailed_description: A geometry-complete diffusion generative model (GCDM) designed for 3D molecule generation and optimization. It is used in drug discovery and computational chemistry to generate valid molecular structures.

name: WrenAI
one_line_profile: AI agent for text-to-SQL and automated business intelligence visualization
detailed_description: A generative BI agent that enables users to query databases using natural language, automatically generating SQL queries and interactive visualizations. It facilitates data analysis and insight extraction from structured data sources.

name: Datu Core
one_line_profile: Open-source AI analyst for automated data analysis
detailed_description: Datu Core is an AI-powered analyst tool designed to automate data analysis tasks. It likely provides functionalities to interpret data, generate insights, and potentially visualize results, fitting within the domain of AI-assisted data insight.

name: DataHorse
one_line_profile: Natural language interface for data analysis and visualization
detailed_description: DataHorse allows users to chat with their data, modify it, visualize it, and create machine learning models using plain English. It leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to make data science and analysis conversational and accessible.

name: DeepBI
one_line_profile: LLM-based AI native business intelligence and data science tool
detailed_description: DeepBI is an AI-native data application that functions as an LLM-based data scientist. It aims to redefine Business Intelligence (BI) through AI-driven infinite thinking, enabling automated data analysis and insight generation.

name: lidar-camera-fusion
one_line_profile: Tool for projecting LiDAR point clouds onto RGB camera images
detailed_description: This tool implements the projection of 3D point clouds obtained from a Velodyne VLP16 LiDAR sensor onto 2D images from an RGB camera within a ROS environment. It is used for sensor fusion visualization and data processing in robotics and perception research.

name: Codify
one_line_profile: Natural language to code converter for data science tasks
detailed_description: Codify enables data scientists to perform tasks such as Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA), data cleaning, preprocessing, visualization, and modeling by conveying the logic in natural language. The system automatically generates the relevant Python code snippets.

name: Data-Purifier
one_line_profile: Library for automated EDA, data cleaning, and preprocessing
detailed_description: Data-Purifier is a Python library designed for Automated Exploratory Data Analysis (AutoEDA), Automated Data Cleaning, and Automated Data Preprocessing. It is tailored for Machine Learning and Natural Language Processing applications, streamlining the data preparation phase.

name: MathViz-E
one_line_profile: Voice-driven AI agent for mathematical visualization
detailed_description: MathViz-E is an AI Agent that enables users to create mathematical visualizations through voice commands. It interprets natural language to generate plots and visual representations of mathematical concepts.

name: AgentWorkbench
one_line_profile: Toolkit for JADE-based multi-agent system interaction and visualization
detailed_description: AgentWorkbench is an application toolkit based on the JADE framework. It provides functionalities for handling time aspects, agent-environment interaction, visualization, and load balancing, focusing on usability for end-users in multi-agent system research.

name: bagel
one_line_profile: Conversational interface for robotics and IoT data analysis
detailed_description: Bagel enables users to chat with data from robotics, drones, and IoT devices. It acts as a 'ChatGPT for the physical world', facilitating the analysis and interaction with engineering and scientific data generated by physical systems.

name: Auto-Analyst
one_line_profile: Open-source AI-powered data science platform
detailed_description: Auto-Analyst is an open-source platform designed to act as an AI data scientist. It automates various data science tasks, likely including data analysis and insight generation, to streamline the workflow for data professionals.

name: Auto-Analyst-Streamlit
one_line_profile: Streamlit interface for Auto-Analyst AI data scientist
detailed_description: This repository contains the Streamlit-based user interface for the Auto-Analyst platform. It provides an interactive web application for users to leverage the AI data scientist capabilities for data analysis.

name: class-incremental-learning
one_line_profile: PyTorch implementation of class-incremental learning algorithms
detailed_description: This repository provides PyTorch implementations of various class-incremental learning methods, including VAE-based generative classifiers and others like EWC, SI, and LwF. It serves as a library for researching and developing continual learning models.

name: continual-learning
one_line_profile: Comprehensive library for continual learning methods in PyTorch
detailed_description: A robust PyTorch implementation of numerous continual learning algorithms (e.g., EWC, SI, LwF, iCaRL, GEM). It allows researchers to experiment with and compare different strategies for learning from continuous data streams without catastrophic forgetting.

name: llm_qualitative_data_analysis
one_line_profile: Tool for qualitative data analysis using LLMs
detailed_description: This tool leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) via Langchain and Streamlit to assist in qualitative data analysis. It automates the processing and interpretation of unstructured data, suitable for research involving text analysis.

name: BioBART
one_line_profile: Biomedical generative language model for text processing
detailed_description: BioBART is a biomedical generative language model pretrained on large-scale biomedical corpora. It is designed for various biomedical natural language processing tasks, serving as a foundational model for scientific text analysis in biology and medicine.

name: Open Data QnA
one_line_profile: Conversational interface for database interaction using LLM Agents
detailed_description: Open Data QnA is a Python library that enables users to chat with their databases using LLM Agents on Google Cloud. It implements NL2SQL (Natural Language to SQL) methods to facilitate conversational data analysis and retrieval.

name: Grid2Viz

detailed_description: A dedicated visualization tool designed to analyze and display the decision-making process of RL agents within the Grid2Op framework for power network management.

name: mpl-tc-fonts

detailed_description: A Python package designed to resolve font rendering issues (Tofu) when using Traditional Chinese characters in Matplotlib scientific plots.

detailed_description: A robust C++ implementation for detecting and tracking multiple objects in 3D space using LiDAR point cloud data, essential for autonomous systems research.

one_line_profile: Correction tool for moving object distortion in oscillating scanning LiDARs
detailed_description: An algorithm implementation to correct point cloud distortion caused by moving objects in oscillating scanning LiDARs by fusing data with camera inputs.

name: Chart2Text

detailed_description: A tool that adapts Transformer models to generate natural language summaries and explanations directly from chart data, facilitating automated insight generation.

detailed_description: A lightweight Python tool designed to automate the process of exploratory data analysis, providing quick insights and visualizations for datasets.

name: Rath

detailed_description: An open-source, AI-augmented automated data analysis and visualization tool that discovers patterns, insights, and causal relationships in multi-dimensional data.

detailed_description: A Python library implementing the PCS (Predictability, Computability, Stability) framework to facilitate the construction of reliable and interpretable data science pipelines.

detailed_description: A ROS package for estimating calibration parameters between camera and LiDAR frames, featuring optimized sample selection for improved robustness.

name: Thread

detailed_description: A Jupyter Notebook interface enhanced with local AI capabilities to generate code cells, automatically fix errors, and enable natural language chat with data, streamlining the scientific analysis workflow.

detailed_description: A Python library that enables the construction of robust data processing and analysis pipelines leveraging Large Language Models, useful for extracting structured scientific data from unstructured text or performing semantic filtering.

detailed_description: A ROS package designed to find the rigid-body transformation between a LiDAR and a camera using 3D-3D point correspondences, essential for sensor fusion and data alignment in robotics and autonomous systems research.

name: sketch

detailed_description: An AI assistant extension for pandas that understands data context, allowing users to ask natural language questions to generate code, create visualizations, and gain insights directly from their dataframes.

name: StringZilla

detailed_description: A hyper-optimized string processing library leveraging SIMD (AVX-512, NEON) for accelerated search, hashing, edit distances, and sketching (MinHash), widely applicable in bioinformatics (sequence analysis) and large-scale text mining.

name: BagOfWords
one_line_profile: AI analyst platform for converting natural language to SQL, Python code, and dashboards
detailed_description: BagOfWords is an AI-powered data analysis platform that connects LLMs to various data sources. It provides capabilities for Text-to-SQL, Text-to-Python, and Text-to-Dashboard generation, enabling automated insight extraction and visualization construction from natural language queries.

name: Bodo
one_line_profile: High-performance parallel compute engine for Python data analytics
detailed_description: Bodo is a high-performance data processing engine that automatically parallelizes Python code (Pandas/NumPy) for HPC-level performance. It is essential for interactive analysis of large-scale scientific datasets, enabling scientists to run standard Python data workflows at supercomputing scale.

name: AI Data Science Team
one_line_profile: Multi-agent framework for automating data science and analysis workflows
detailed_description: A framework of AI agents designed to perform common data science tasks such as data cleaning, exploratory data analysis (EDA), and visualization. It acts as an automated assistant for data analysts and scientists to accelerate the insight generation process.

name: Neat Vision
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for NLP model attention mechanisms
detailed_description: Neat Vision is a framework-agnostic visualization tool designed to analyze and display the attention mechanisms of deep learning models used in Natural Language Processing. It aids researchers in understanding model behavior and interpreting internal representations.

name: Helipad
one_line_profile: An agent-based modeling framework for Python with interactive visualization
detailed_description: Helipad is an agent-based modeling (ABM) framework designed for scientific simulation in fields like economics, biology, and social sciences. It provides a hook-based architecture for defining agent behaviors and includes powerful real-time visualization capabilities to observe model dynamics and collect data.

name: Lidar_IMU_Localization
one_line_profile: Lidar-IMU localization system with prior map and LIO constraints
detailed_description: A robotics research tool for 3D localization using Lidar and IMU sensor fusion. It implements advanced algorithms for state estimation and mapping, utilizing prior map constraints to improve accuracy in complex environments, applicable in autonomous systems and spatial analysis.

name: lidar_imu_calib

detailed_description: A scientific tool for the automatic calibration of extrinsic parameters between 3D Lidar sensors and Inertial Measurement Units (IMU). It addresses the sensor alignment problem critical for accurate data collection in robotics and mobile mapping systems.

name: PEDSIM

detailed_description: PEDSIM is a microscopic pedestrian crowd simulation library suitable for crowd dynamics research, evacuation simulation, and architectural visualization. It allows for quantitative measurements of pedestrian density and evacuation times, supporting scientific studies in safety and social dynamics.

name: Spectral-Clara-Lux-Tracer

detailed_description: A physically based rendering engine that supports multiple shading models and Color Rendering Index (CRI) evaluation. It is designed for optical simulation and research into light transport and spectral rendering techniques.

name: ifc-2-duckdb

name: Pattern

It is widely used in computational linguistics and social science research.

name: MiniAgents

detailed_description: A visualization tool designed for analyzing and observing the behavior of 'simulacra' or mini-agents in a simulation environment. It aids in the study of agent-based systems and emergent behaviors.

name: data-analysis-llm-agent

detailed_description: An AI agent designed to automate data analysis tasks. It leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to generate SQL queries from natural language, execute them against databases, and automatically visualize the results, facilitating automated insight generation.

name: auto-eda

name: DataLingua

detailed_description: An AI tool that transforms natural language questions into interactive data visualizations. It automatically generates and executes SQL queries based on user input, allowing for data exploration without requiring SQL knowledge.

name: fhiry

detailed_description: A utility library that converts FHIR (Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources) bundles into Pandas DataFrames. This enables data scientists and researchers to easily perform analytics and machine learning on standardized medical health records.

name: ExcelChat
one_line_profile: Streamlit application for chatting with Excel files
detailed_description: A web application built with Streamlit that allows users to interact with Excel files using natural language. It enables users to ask questions about their data and receive answers or insights, functioning as an automated insight tool for spreadsheet data.

name: nlg-metricverse
one_line_profile: End-to-end library for evaluating Natural Language Generation (NLG) models
detailed_description: A comprehensive Python library designed to streamline the evaluation of Natural Language Generation models. It provides a unified interface for accessing a wide range of metrics, visualization tools, and benchmarking capabilities, facilitating rigorous assessment of NLG systems.

name: AgentOk
one_line_profile: Visual platform for building and orchestrating multi-agent AI applications
detailed_description: A low-code/no-code platform that enables the visual construction and orchestration of multi-agent systems. It allows users to design agent workflows, interactions, and logic using a drag-and-drop interface, facilitating the development of complex AI agentic applications.

name: llmgraph
one_line_profile: Tool for generating knowledge graphs from text using LLMs
detailed_description: A tool that leverages Large Language Models (LLMs) to extract entities and relationships from text and construct knowledge graphs. It enables the visualization of complex information structures and supports automated insight generation from unstructured data.

name: Culebra

detailed_description: A computational design tool that implements multi-agent systems within the Grasshopper/Rhino environment. It enables the simulation of complex, dynamic behaviors and interactions for architectural and spatial design, supporting 2D/3D visualization and data analysis.

name: Culebra_Java

detailed_description: The core Java library powering the Culebra multi-agent system. It provides the fundamental objects and behaviors for creating dynamic multi-agent interactions, focused on hybrid system interactions with custom visualization and performance features.

name: lidar_align

detailed_description: A method and tool for finding the extrinsic calibration (relative rotation and translation) between a 3D Lidar and a 6-DOF pose sensor (e.g., IMU, GNSS, or odometry). It optimizes the alignment to minimize the error between the Lidar scans and the trajectory.

name: agent-prism
one_line_profile: Visualization components for AI agent execution traces
detailed_description: A library of React components designed to visualize the execution traces and internal reasoning processes of AI agents. It helps researchers and developers debug, understand, and analyze the behavior of autonomous agents through interactive visualizations.

name: Sweetviz

detailed_description: A Python library that generates high-density, fully self-contained HTML reports for Exploratory Data Analysis (EDA). It allows for quick visualization and comparison of datasets, target value analysis, and feature association discovery with minimal code.

name: LuxGI

detailed_description: A hybrid Global Illumination (GI) rendering solution that combines Ray-Tracing and SDF-Tracing based on DDGI (Dynamic Diffuse Global Illumination). It is designed for high-quality, real-time lighting simulation in computer graphics.

name: RTutor
one_line_profile: AI-powered tool for natural language data analysis and code generation
detailed_description: An AI-based tool that allows users to interact with their data using natural language. It automatically generates R code for data analysis and visualization, executing it to provide insights and plots, effectively bridging the gap between natural language and statistical programming.

name: BIA Bob

detailed_description: A Jupyter and LLM-based assistant designed to help researchers interact with bio-image data. It generates code for image processing tasks, facilitating bio-image analysis workflows through natural language prompts.

name: LiDAR_IMU_Init

detailed_description: An algorithm implementation for initializing LiDAR-inertial systems. It provides robust estimation of temporal and spatial parameters for sensor fusion, critical for mapping and SLAM tasks in dynamic environments.

name: joint-lidar-camera-calib

detailed_description: A C++ tool developed by HKU-MARS for the joint calibration of LiDAR and camera systems. It handles both intrinsic and extrinsic parameters to ensure accurate data alignment for 3D perception and mapping.

name: GemInsights

detailed_description: A tool that leverages Gemini AI to analyze dataframes and generate insights, offering an automated alternative to traditional manual data analysis methods.

name: direct_visual_lidar_calibration

name: SPHinXsys

detailed_description: A C++ library providing APIs for engineering simulation and optimization, focusing on complex systems driven by fluid, structure, and multi-body dynamics using the Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH) method.

name: Zettlr
one_line_profile: Markdown editor optimized for academic writing and publishing
detailed_description: A robust Markdown editor designed specifically for researchers and journalists, featuring integrated citation management (Zotero/BibTex), Zettelkasten support, and export capabilities for academic publications.

name: nbconflux
one_line_profile: Utility to convert Jupyter Notebooks into Atlassian Confluence pages
detailed_description: nbconflux is a tool that converts Jupyter Notebooks into Atlassian Confluence pages using nbconvert. It facilitates the dissemination of scientific analysis and reports within organizations by bridging the gap between computational notebooks and documentation platforms.

name: rrtools
one_line_profile: Tools for creating reproducible research compendiums in R
detailed_description: A package that provides instructions, templates, and functions for creating a basic compendium for reproducible research with R, facilitating the organization of data, analysis, and reporting.

name: colab-pdf
one_line_profile: Utility to convert Google Colab notebooks to PDF reports
detailed_description: A simple utility script that allows researchers to convert Jupyter Notebooks hosted on Google Colab into PDF reports, facilitating the sharing and archiving of scientific analysis results.

name: ipypublish
one_line_profile: Workflow for creating publication-ready scientific reports from Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A workflow and set of tools for creating and editing publication-ready scientific reports, presentations, and articles directly from Jupyter Notebooks, supporting various output formats and citation handling.

name: voila
one_line_profile: R package for Variational Inference for Langevin Equations
detailed_description: A library performing variational inference for Langevin equations, useful in statistical physics and stochastic modeling.

name: quarto-pyodide
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for interactive Python in HTML documents
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that enables interactive Python code cells in HTML documents using Pyodide, facilitating reproducible scientific reporting and education.

name: quarto-webr
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for interactive R in HTML documents
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that embeds webR to enable interactive R code execution in HTML documents, websites, and books for scientific communication.

name: CodaLab Worksheets
one_line_profile: Collaborative platform for reproducible research
detailed_description: A platform that enables researchers to create reproducible experiments and executable papers by managing code, data, and results in a worksheet format.

name: jupyter_publish
one_line_profile: Publication ready scientific reports from Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A tool to convert Jupyter notebooks into publication-ready scientific reports and presentations, handling citations and formatting.

name: CrossCompute
one_line_profile: Automate Jupyter notebooks as web-based reports and tools
detailed_description: A framework that turns Jupyter notebooks and scripts into interactive web-based reports, tools, and dashboards for sharing scientific analysis.

name: d2l-book
one_line_profile: Toolkit for building books from Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: An open-source tool used to build and publish interactive books based on Jupyter notebooks, widely used for educational scientific content.

name: pheasant
one_line_profile: Markdown conversion tool with Jupyter execution
detailed_description: A documentation tool that converts Markdown files with embedded code blocks into HTML, executing the code via Jupyter client for reproducible reports.

name: PeerReview
one_line_profile: Open source scientific and academic publishing platform
detailed_description: A diamond open access platform designed for scientific and academic publishing, facilitating the peer review and dissemination process.

name: Datapane
one_line_profile: Build and share data reports in Python
detailed_description: A Python library for building interactive reports from data analysis scripts, allowing embedding of plots, dataframes, and markdown.

name: jupyter2slides
one_line_profile: Convert Jupyter Notebooks to Reveal.js slides
detailed_description: A tool to transform Jupyter Notebooks into cloud-native presentation slides using Reveal.js, facilitating scientific communication.

name: pandiff
one_line_profile: Prose diffs for Pandoc documents
detailed_description: A CLI tool to generate prose diffs for any document format supported by Pandoc, useful for tracking changes in scientific papers and manuscripts.

name: summarytools
one_line_profile: R package for data summarization
detailed_description: An R package that provides tools to quickly and neatly summarize data, generating frequency tables and descriptive statistics for reports.

name: python-literate
one_line_profile: Literate programming for Python research notebooks
detailed_description: A tool enabling literate programming in Python, allowing researchers to write research notebooks that mix markdown and code for better documentation and reproducibility.

name: convert-markdown
one_line_profile: Convert Markdown to reports with executed code
detailed_description: A tool to convert Markdown files into HTML or PDF reports with executed code blocks, supporting plots and charts for scientific reporting.

name: encryptedRmd
one_line_profile: R package to create password protected self-contained HTML reports from RMarkdown
detailed_description: A utility for RMarkdown that allows users to encrypt the output HTML file using libsodium. This ensures that sensitive scientific reports or data visualizations can be shared securely while maintaining the reproducibility and interactivity of RMarkdown documents.

name: nbautoexport
one_line_profile: Automatic export of Jupyter notebooks to script formats on save
detailed_description: A tool that automatically exports Jupyter notebooks to various file formats (such as .py scripts or HTML) whenever they are saved. This facilitates version control and code review in scientific workflows involving notebooks.

name: duecredit
one_line_profile: Automated citation collection for scientific software and methods
detailed_description: A framework that allows scientists to automatically collect and report citations for the software, methods, and datasets used in their analysis scripts. It helps ensure proper credit attribution in reproducible research.

name: CodeDepends
one_line_profile: Static analysis tool for R code dependencies
detailed_description: A tool for analyzing dependencies within R code to support reproducible research. It helps identify input/output variables, library dependencies, and code structure to facilitate understanding and refactoring of analysis scripts.

name: report
one_line_profile: Automated reporting of statistical models in R
detailed_description: Part of the easystats ecosystem, this package automatically generates text reports from statistical models and data frames. It interprets model results and formats them according to scientific standards (e.g., APA style), bridging the gap between analysis and manuscript writing.

name: nb2md
one_line_profile: Converter for Jupyter and Zeppelin notebooks to Markdown
detailed_description: A command-line tool to convert Jupyter and Zeppelin notebooks into standard Markdown or Jupyter formats. Useful for extracting content from notebooks for documentation or blog posts in a scientific workflow.

name: entangled
one_line_profile: Bi-directional literate programming daemon
detailed_description: A tool for literate programming that maintains synchronization between Markdown documentation and source code files. It allows scientists to write code and documentation in a single file and automatically updates the source files, supporting reproducible research workflows.

name: pygeoapi-kubernetes-papermill
one_line_profile: Execute Jupyter Notebooks on Kubernetes via OGC API
detailed_description: A solution for running parameterized Jupyter Notebooks (via Papermill) on a Kubernetes cluster, triggered through the OGC API - Processes standard (via pygeoapi). This enables scalable and standardized execution of scientific workflows.

name: papermill-mlflow
one_line_profile: Integration of Papermill and MLflow for experiment tracking
detailed_description: A tool that combines Papermill (for parameterized notebook execution) with MLflow (for experiment tracking). It allows data scientists to run notebooks as experiments and automatically log parameters, metrics, and artifacts to MLflow.

name: MyST-Parser
one_line_profile: Extended CommonMark compliant parser for Sphinx
detailed_description: A parser for Markedly Structured Text (MyST), a rich Markdown flavor designed for scientific documentation and publishing. It integrates with Sphinx to allow writing technical documentation and executable books in Markdown instead of reStructuredText.

name: LIGHT
one_line_profile: Platform for text-situated dialogue research and interaction
detailed_description: A large-scale crowdsourced fantasy text-adventure game platform designed for research in dialogue, grounded interaction, and agents.

name: Code World Model (CWM)
one_line_profile: Inference tools and artifacts for Code World Model research
detailed_description: Research code artifacts including inference tools and reproducibility scripts for the Code World Model, enabling reasoning and generation tasks.

name: Recipes
one_line_profile: Blueprints for rapid ML model training and reproducibility
detailed_description: A collection of standard blueprints and reference implementations for training state-of-the-art machine learning models, ensuring correctness and efficiency.

name: fastdoc
one_line_profile: Tool to create publication-quality books from Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A tool designed to convert Jupyter notebooks into publication-quality books, supporting scientific documentation and reporting workflows.

name: BacAnnot
one_line_profile: Pipeline for prokaryotic genome annotation with interactive reports
detailed_description: A comprehensive pipeline for prokaryotic genome annotation and interrogation, featuring interactive reports and a Shiny app for data visualization.

name: Literate.jl
one_line_profile: Literate programming tool for Julia
detailed_description: A package for literate programming in Julia, allowing generation of Markdown, Jupyter Notebooks, and scripts from a single source file, facilitating reproducible research.

name: epoxy
one_line_profile: Templating engine for R Markdown and Quarto reports
detailed_description: Provides extra-strength glue engines for R Markdown, Quarto, and Shiny, enabling dynamic data injection into scientific reports and documents.

name: eeconvert
one_line_profile: Earth Engine object conversion for Jupyter
detailed_description: A Python library to convert Google Earth Engine objects to client-side formats (like GeoJSON or pandas DataFrame) for use in Jupyter notebooks.

name: ARPIR
one_line_profile: Automatic RNA-Seq Pipelines with Interactive Report
detailed_description: A pipeline for RNA-Seq data analysis that generates interactive reports, facilitating the exploration and interpretation of transcriptomic data.

name: Codebraid
one_line_profile: Live code execution in Pandoc Markdown for reproducible reports
detailed_description: Codebraid is a Python-based tool that enables live code execution within Pandoc Markdown documents. It supports multiple programming languages and is designed to facilitate reproducible research and report generation by embedding code output directly into documents.

name: HELP
one_line_profile: Literate programming tool for mixing code and documentation
detailed_description: HELP is a tool designed to enable literate programming, allowing users to combine source code and documentation in a single file to produce reproducible outputs.

name: markdoc
one_line_profile: Literate programming package for Stata
detailed_description: Markdoc is a Stata package that enables literate programming by allowing users to create dynamic documents, slides, and help files directly from Stata scripts, facilitating reproducible research in econometrics and statistics.

name: nbsanity
one_line_profile: Jupyter notebook renderer using Quarto
detailed_description: nbsanity is a utility to render Jupyter notebooks into static HTML using Quarto as the rendering engine, providing a viewer similar to nbviewer but with Quarto's styling and features.

name: htmldocs
one_line_profile: React-based PDF document generator
detailed_description: htmldocs is a tool for creating PDF documents using React, JSX, and Tailwind CSS. It serves as a modern alternative to LaTeX for generating scientific or technical reports.

name: scrivomatic
one_line_profile: Workflow tool for Scrivener and Pandoc integration
detailed_description: Scrivomatic is a workflow tool that connects Scrivener's writing environment with Pandoc's document conversion capabilities, enabling the production of formatted academic and scientific documents from Scrivener projects.

name: CT2Rep
one_line_profile: Automated radiology report generation for 3D medical imaging
detailed_description: CT2Rep is a deep learning framework designed to automatically generate radiology reports from 3D medical imaging (CT scans), facilitating automated medical diagnosis and documentation.

name: codex_dashboard
one_line_profile: Dashboard for Single Cell Multiplexed Imaging (CODEX) data
detailed_description: A Jupyter Voila dashboard designed for the interactive visualization and analysis of Single Cell Multiplexed Imaging (CODEX) data, enabling researchers to explore spatial cellular data.

name: litr
one_line_profile: Literate programming tool for writing R packages
detailed_description: litr is an R package that enables writing R packages using literate programming techniques. It allows developers to define code, documentation, and tests in a single R Markdown file.

name: book-report
one_line_profile: Interactive notebook generator for Clojure
detailed_description: book-report is a Clojure library that converts files into interactive notebooks, facilitating literate programming and the creation of educational or research reports in Clojure.

name: nbmerge
one_line_profile: Tool to merge/concatenate Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A command-line utility to merge multiple Jupyter (IPython) notebooks into a single notebook. This is essential for scientific workflows where analysis is split across multiple stages or chapters and needs to be combined for final reporting.

name: Pandoc
one_line_profile: Universal markup converter for scientific publishing
detailed_description: A universal markup converter that serves as the core engine for many scientific publishing workflows (including RMarkdown, Jupyter Book, and Quarto). It handles conversion between formats like LaTeX, Markdown, HTML, and Word, supporting scientific features like citations (BibTeX/CSL), math rendering, and complex tables.

name: pandocfilters
one_line_profile: Python module for writing Pandoc filters
detailed_description: A Python library that simplifies writing filters for Pandoc. These filters are used to programmatically modify the abstract syntax tree (AST) of scientific documents during conversion, enabling custom features like automated figure numbering, code execution, or citation formatting.

name: renderthis
one_line_profile: R package for rendering xaringan slides to multiple formats
detailed_description: An R package designed to render 'xaringan' slides (a popular HTML5 presentation framework for R users) into various static formats like PDF, PNG, GIF, and PPTX. This facilitates the sharing and archiving of scientific presentations.

name: noteMD
one_line_profile: Print text from Shiny UI to PDF/Word reports
detailed_description: An R package that allows users to capture text input from Shiny applications (interactive scientific web dashboards) and render it into PDF or Word reports using R Markdown. This bridges the gap between interactive data exploration and static reporting.

name: quarto-svelte
one_line_profile: Add Svelte components to Quarto documents
detailed_description: An extension for Quarto (a scientific and technical publishing system) that allows embedding Svelte components. This enables the creation of highly interactive and reactive scientific documents and visualizations within the Quarto ecosystem.

name: reproducr
one_line_profile: Drafting and publishing reproducible scientific articles with R Markdown
detailed_description: An R package that provides a workflow and templates for drafting and publishing reproducible scientific articles. It leverages R Markdown to integrate code, data, and text, ensuring that research outputs are transparent and reproducible.

name: nb2jekyll
one_line_profile: Convert Jupyter Notebooks to Jekyll-compatible Markdown
detailed_description: A tool that uses nbconvert to transform Jupyter Notebooks into Markdown files with Front Matter suitable for Jekyll static sites. This supports the workflow of scientists publishing their research notes and analysis as blogs or static websites.

name: pyobsplot
one_line_profile: Observable Plot for Python and Jupyter
detailed_description: A Python library that provides an interface to Observable Plot, a high-level JavaScript library for exploratory data visualization. It allows data scientists to create expressive, interactive charts directly within Jupyter notebooks or Python scripts.

name: Jupyter Book
one_line_profile: Create publication-quality books from computational content
detailed_description: An open-source tool for building beautiful, publication-quality books and documents from computational material (Jupyter Notebooks, Markdown). It is widely used in the scientific community for creating course materials, research reports, and data science documentation.

name: nbclient
one_line_profile: Client library for executing Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A client library for programmatically executing Jupyter Notebooks. It allows for the automation of notebook execution, which is critical for testing, report generation pipelines, and reproducible research workflows where notebooks need to be run in a headless environment.

name: nbconvert
one_line_profile: Standard tool for converting Jupyter Notebooks to static formats
detailed_description: The standard tool for converting Jupyter Notebooks into various static formats including HTML, LaTeX, PDF, Markdown, and reStructuredText. It is a critical component in the reproducible research workflow, enabling the transformation of computational narratives into publication-ready documents and reports.

name: nbviewer
one_line_profile: Web service for rendering Jupyter Notebooks as static web pages
detailed_description: A web application that renders Jupyter Notebooks hosted on GitHub or other accessible URLs as static HTML web pages. It facilitates the sharing and visualization of scientific computational notebooks without requiring a local Jupyter environment.

name: researchpooler
one_line_profile: Automated tool for research paper discovery and analysis
detailed_description: A Python-based tool designed to automate the discovery and analysis of research publications. It helps researchers find papers similar to a given URL or those reporting results on specific datasets, facilitating literature review and meta-analysis.

name: fireant
one_line_profile: Data analysis and reporting tool for Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A data analysis and reporting library designed to provide quick access to custom charts and tables within Jupyter Notebooks. It streamlines the process of generating visualizations and reports from dataframes, supporting scientific data exploration.

name: molecule-slide-generator
one_line_profile: Generates molecular images for presentations and reports
detailed_description: A Python tool that generates images of chemical molecules and their properties, specifically designed for use in scientific presentations and reports. It automates the visualization of chemical structures for documentation purposes.

name: hide_code
one_line_profile: Jupyter extension to hide code for cleaner reports
detailed_description: A Jupyter/IPython notebook extension that allows users to hide code, prompts, and outputs. It is essential for generating clean, readable scientific reports and presentations where the underlying code should be obscured in favor of the results and narrative.

name: jekyllnb
one_line_profile: Converts Jupyter Notebooks to Jekyll-ready Markdown
detailed_description: A tool designed to convert Jupyter Notebooks into Jekyll-ready Markdown files. This facilitates the publication of scientific notebooks and computational analyses on static websites and blogs, supporting the dissemination of research.

name: yason
one_line_profile: Remote scheduler for Jupyter Notebooks on Kubernetes
detailed_description: A remote scheduler for executing Jupyter Notebooks as workflows on Kubernetes using Argo. It enables the automation and scaling of scientific computational workflows defined in notebooks.

name: mimicry
one_line_profile: PyTorch GAN library for reproducing research results
detailed_description: A lightweight PyTorch library designed to reproduce research results for popular Generative Adversarial Networks (GANs). It provides a standardized framework for comparing and implementing GAN models in scientific research.

name: pandoc-crossref
one_line_profile: Pandoc filter for numbering and cross-referencing
detailed_description: A Pandoc filter for numbering figures, equations, tables, and cross-referencing them. It is a vital tool for academic and scientific writing using Markdown/Pandoc workflows, ensuring correct document structure and citation.

name: PyBloqs
one_line_profile: Flexible framework for data visualization and automated report generation
detailed_description: A Python framework designed for creating high-quality, reproducible reports and data visualizations. It allows users to compose documents containing plots, tables, and text, and export them to various formats like HTML and PDF, suitable for quantitative research and data analysis reporting.

name: Manubot
one_line_profile: Workflow for writing reproducible scientific manuscripts
detailed_description: A toolchain for writing scientific manuscripts using Markdown and Git. It automates the process of citation generation, versioning, and format conversion (HTML, PDF, DOCX), promoting open and collaborative scientific writing.

name: quarto-marimo
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for embedding reactive Marimo notebooks
detailed_description: An extension for the Quarto scientific publishing system that enables the execution and embedding of reactive Python code from Marimo notebooks directly into Quarto reports and documents.

name: JAMS
one_line_profile: JSON Annotated Music Specification library for MIR research
detailed_description: A Python library and specification for handling rich, structured annotations in Music Information Retrieval (MIR) research. It ensures data reproducibility and interoperability for scientific music analysis tasks.

name: RD-Agent
one_line_profile: AI-driven agent for automating R&D workflows
detailed_description: An AI agent framework developed by Microsoft designed to automate data-driven research and development (R&D) processes. It focuses on tasks such as data processing, model building, and experiment tracking, enabling 'AI driving data-driven AI' in industrial and scientific settings.

name: Archai
one_line_profile: Platform for Neural Architecture Search (NAS) and model optimization
detailed_description: Archai is a platform for Neural Architecture Search (NAS) that allows researchers to generate, search, and optimize efficient neural networks. It supports various search algorithms and is designed to accelerate research in finding optimal model architectures for scientific and general AI tasks.

name: Collective Knowledge (CK)
one_line_profile: Framework for collaborative and reproducible research and benchmarking
detailed_description: Collective Knowledge (CK) is a framework designed to facilitate collaborative and reproducible research, particularly in AI and ML systems. It provides automations for benchmarking (MLPerf), optimizing, and sharing research workflows, models, and datasets across diverse hardware and software stacks.

name: jupytext
one_line_profile: Tool for converting Jupyter Notebooks to text formats for version control
detailed_description: Jupytext is a tool that allows Jupyter notebooks to be saved as Markdown documents or scripts (Python, R, Julia). This facilitates version control, code review, and collaborative editing of scientific workflows, addressing a key challenge in reproducible research with notebooks.

name: nbprint
one_line_profile: Framework for creating print-oriented layouts from Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: nbprint is a framework designed to build print-oriented media (PDFs, reports) using Jupyter Notebooks. It allows researchers to use HTML and CSS to style notebook outputs specifically for printing, enabling the creation of high-quality scientific reports directly from analysis code.

name: Arakawa
one_line_profile: Python-based data reporting library (fork of Datapane)
detailed_description: A Python library for building interactive data reports and dashboards, serving as an open-source fork of Datapane to ensure continued availability of reporting capabilities.

name: Quarto Titlepages
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for custom PDF title pages
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that provides templates and functionality for creating professional title and cover pages for PDF outputs in scientific publishing.

name: Papermill Origami
one_line_profile: Papermill engine for Noteable notebooks
detailed_description: A specialized engine for Papermill that enables the execution and parameterization of Noteable-hosted Jupyter notebooks for reproducible workflows.

name: MetroloPy
one_line_profile: Tools for uncertainty propagation and unit conversion
detailed_description: A Python library designed for metrology applications, handling measurement unit conversions and the propagation of uncertainties in scientific calculations.

name: PrettyPDF
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for aesthetic PDF reports
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that applies aesthetic LaTeX styling to PDF outputs, facilitating the creation of visually appealing scientific reports.

name: noweb
one_line_profile: Literate programming tool
detailed_description: A simple, extensible tool for literate programming, allowing code and documentation to be interleaved in a single source file, supporting reproducible research practices.

name: Papermill
one_line_profile: Parameterize, execute, and analyze notebooks
detailed_description: A tool for parameterizing and executing Jupyter Notebooks, enabling them to be used as isolated, reproducible steps in data pipelines and report generation workflows.

name: papermillr
one_line_profile: R bindings for Papermill
detailed_description: An R interface for Papermill, allowing R users to parameterize and execute Jupyter Notebooks programmatically.

name: Scrapbook
one_line_profile: Library for recording and reading data in notebooks
detailed_description: A library that allows notebooks to record data snippets (scraps) and plots, which can then be read by other notebooks or tools, facilitating data exchange in notebook-based pipelines.

name: numpydoc
one_line_profile: Sphinx extension for NumPy style docstrings
detailed_description: A Sphinx extension that handles the NumPy documentation format, essential for generating documentation and reports for scientific Python software.

name: Observable Framework
one_line_profile: Static site generator for data apps and reports
detailed_description: A framework for building fast, static data dashboards and reports, combining JavaScript for interactive visualization with any backend language for data analysis.

name: Amphion
one_line_profile: Toolkit for Audio, Music, and Speech Generation
detailed_description: An open-source toolkit for audio, music, and speech generation research, supporting reproducible research in generative AI models.

name: Sumatra
one_line_profile: Automated electronic lab notebook for simulation projects
detailed_description: A tool for managing and tracking numerical simulation and analysis projects, acting as an automated electronic lab notebook to support reproducible research.

name: OpenCPU

detailed_description: A system that exposes R functions as REST APIs, enabling embedded scientific computing and the creation of reproducible research applications.

name: testipynb
one_line_profile: Unit testing for Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A tool for running unit tests on a collection of Jupyter notebooks using nbconvert, ensuring the correctness and reproducibility of notebook-based scientific code.

name: nb_to_html

detailed_description: An HTTP endpoint service that converts Jupyter Notebooks into dynamic HTML reports on demand, facilitating the sharing of scientific analysis results.

name: ipynb2LiterateJulia

detailed_description: A tool to convert Jupyter Notebooks into Julia Literate.jl files, supporting reproducible research workflows in the Julia ecosystem.

name: pandoc-scholar
one_line_profile: Pandoc wrapper for creating semantic scientific articles and reports
detailed_description: A toolchain built on top of Pandoc to facilitate the creation of beautiful and semantically meaningful scientific articles, handling metadata and formatting for academic publishing.

name: csasdown

detailed_description: An R package designed to create Canadian Science Advisory Secretariat (CSAS) reports in PDF or Word format using R Markdown and bookdown, facilitating reproducible research in fisheries and ocean science.

name: RISEkbmRasch
one_line_profile: R package for Rasch Measurement Theory psychometrics
detailed_description: An R package for performing psychometric analysis based on Rasch Measurement Theory, designed for integration with the Quarto scientific publishing system.

name: chronicle
one_line_profile: R package for sequential R Markdown report generation
detailed_description: An R package that provides a sequential syntax inspired by ggplot to create R Markdown reports, simplifying the process of generating reproducible scientific documents.

name: ploomber
one_line_profile: Workflow orchestration for reproducible data pipelines
detailed_description: A framework to build modular data pipelines that can be developed iteratively and deployed anywhere. It supports Jupyter notebooks as tasks, facilitating reproducible scientific reporting and analysis workflows.

name: ploomber-engine
one_line_profile: Toolbox for executing and testing Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A library for executing, testing, debugging, and profiling Jupyter notebooks, enhancing their use in scientific workflows and reproducible report generation.

name: podoc
one_line_profile: Pandoc-compatible document conversion for Jupyter
detailed_description: A Python library for converting documents between formats (Markdown, Jupyter Notebooks, etc.), designed to be Pandoc-compatible and Jupyter-aware for scientific documentation workflows.

name: skore
one_line_profile: Automated ML evaluation reporting and analysis
detailed_description: A Python library that accelerates machine learning model development by providing automated evaluation reports, methodological guidance, and cross-validation analysis.

name: PyRDM
one_line_profile: Research Data Management library for automated publication
detailed_description: A Python library for Research Data Management (RDM) that facilitates the automated publication of scientific software and associated input/output data to repositories like Figshare or Zenodo.

name: stitch
one_line_profile: Reproducible report generation for Python
detailed_description: A Python tool inspired by Knitr for generating reproducible reports from Markdown files containing Python code, executing the code and embedding results.

name: bookdownplus
one_line_profile: Extensions and templates for R bookdown
detailed_description: An R package that simplifies the use of 'bookdown' for writing varied types of books and scientific documents by providing templates and helper functions.

name: mindr
one_line_profile: Markdown to mindmap converter for research structuring
detailed_description: An R package that converts markdown files (.md, .Rmd) into mindmaps, aiding researchers in structuring and visualizing the outline of scientific reports and papers.

name: closeread
one_line_profile: Scrollytelling extension for Quarto
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that enables 'scrollytelling' features, allowing for interactive and engaging presentation of scientific narratives and data visualizations.

name: Quarto CLI
one_line_profile: Scientific and technical publishing system
detailed_description: An open-source scientific and technical publishing system built on Pandoc. It enables the creation of dynamic content with Python, R, Julia, and Observable, supporting reproducible reports, presentations, websites, and books.

name: quarto-r
one_line_profile: R interface for Quarto
detailed_description: The R package interface to the Quarto CLI, allowing R users to render Quarto documents and projects directly from R/RStudio.

name: quarto-ext/shinylive
one_line_profile: Quarto extension to embed serverless Shiny for Python applications via WebAssembly
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that allows embedding Shinylive applications directly into Quarto documents. It enables the creation of interactive, serverless scientific dashboards and reports that run entirely in the user's browser using Pyodide.

name: ymlthis
one_line_profile: R package to write and manage YAML front matter for R Markdown
detailed_description: An R library designed to assist in writing and managing YAML front matter for R Markdown, bookdown, blogdown, and other reproducible research document formats. It streamlines the configuration of scientific reports.

name: quarto-drop
one_line_profile: Quarto extension for interactive R/Python consoles in slides
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that provides a drop-down interactive console (R or Python) and code editor for Quarto presentations. It utilizes WebAssembly to run code in the browser, enhancing scientific communication and pedagogy.

name: quarto-live
one_line_profile: WebAssembly powered interactive code blocks for Quarto
detailed_description: A Quarto extension that enables interactive code blocks and exercises for R (via WebR) and Python (via Pyodide) in Quarto documents. It allows for reproducible, client-side execution of scientific code within reports.

name: jupyter-zeppelin
one_line_profile: Converter from Zeppelin notes to Jupyter notebooks
detailed_description: A utility script to convert Apache Zeppelin notebooks into Jupyter notebooks. It facilitates the migration and interoperability of scientific data analysis workflows between these two popular platforms.

name: garage
one_line_profile: Toolkit for reproducible reinforcement learning research
detailed_description: A toolkit for developing and evaluating reinforcement learning algorithms. It focuses on reproducibility and provides a collection of high-quality implementations of RL algorithms and environments for scientific research in AI.

name: bookdown
one_line_profile: Authoring framework for reproducible technical books and documents with R Markdown
detailed_description: An open-source R package that facilitates writing books and long-form technical reports with R Markdown. It supports dynamic code execution, cross-references, and multiple output formats (HTML, PDF, ePub), serving as a standard engine for reproducible scientific authorship.

name: rmarkdown
one_line_profile: Dynamic document generation engine for R
detailed_description: A core tool in the R ecosystem for creating dynamic, reproducible documents. It combines code, results (plots, tables), and prose into a single output, supporting dozens of static and dynamic output formats. It is the foundational engine for scientific reporting in R.

name: rticles
one_line_profile: LaTeX journal article templates for R Markdown
detailed_description: A package providing a suite of custom LaTeX templates for various scientific journals and publishers. It enables researchers to write articles in R Markdown and automatically format them to meet specific submission requirements of journals like IEEE, ACM, Elsevier, etc.

name: CoCalc
one_line_profile: Collaborative calculation platform for scientific research and teaching
detailed_description: A web-based cloud computing platform that provides a collaborative environment for SageMath, Jupyter Notebooks, R, LaTeX, and other scientific tools. It supports real-time collaboration on research projects and data analysis.

name: mkdocs-gallery
one_line_profile: Automatic example gallery generator for scientific documentation
detailed_description: A plugin for MkDocs that generates a gallery of examples from Python scripts. It executes the scripts, captures their output (including plots and figures), and embeds them into the documentation. This is widely used for creating reproducible documentation for scientific libraries.

name: strid
one_line_profile: String diagram generator for LaTeX
detailed_description: A tool for generating LaTeX code for string diagrams, which are used in category theory, quantum physics, and logic. It allows users to describe the diagram structure and compiles it into high-quality TikZ/LaTeX visualizations.

name: nbsphinx
one_line_profile: Sphinx source parser for Jupyter notebooks enabling reproducible research reports
detailed_description: A Sphinx extension that provides a source parser for Jupyter notebooks, allowing them to be included in Sphinx documentation. This is critical for generating reproducible scientific reports and documentation sites directly from computational notebooks.

name: Sphinx
one_line_profile: Comprehensive documentation and report generation engine for Python
detailed_description: The standard documentation generator for the Python ecosystem, widely used in scientific computing (e.g., SciPy, NumPy) to generate technical documentation and reports. It supports LaTeX math rendering, code execution, and various output formats (HTML, PDF, LaTeX).

name: Sphinx-Gallery
one_line_profile: Automatic example gallery generator for scientific Python libraries
detailed_description: A Sphinx extension that builds an HTML version of Python scripts, capturing outputs (plots, logs) and structuring them into a gallery. It is a standard tool for creating reproducible examples and tutorials in scientific Python packages.

name: Spyder Reports
one_line_profile: Literate programming and report generation plugin for Spyder IDE
detailed_description: A plugin for the Spyder scientific IDE that allows rendering Markdown reports using Pweave as a backend. It enables scientists to generate reports directly within their analysis environment.

name: bayesplot
one_line_profile: Plotting library for Bayesian models and MCMC diagnostics
detailed_description: An R package providing a library of plotting functions for posterior analysis, MCMC diagnostics, and posterior predictive checking, designed to work with the Stan probabilistic programming ecosystem.

name: HELM
one_line_profile: Holistic Evaluation of Language Models framework
detailed_description: A framework for the holistic, reproducible, and transparent evaluation of foundation models (LLMs). It provides a standardized way to analyze model performance across various metrics, generating detailed reports and visualizations essential for AI research.

name: rfsoc_qpsk
one_line_profile: QPSK transceiver overlay for RFSoC PYNQ
detailed_description: A PYNQ overlay that implements a QPSK (Quadrature Phase Shift Keying) transceiver on Xilinx RFSoC hardware. It serves as a software-defined instrument for signal generation and analysis in radio frequency engineering.

name: rfsoc_sam
one_line_profile: Spectrum Analyser Module for RFSoC PYNQ
detailed_description: An open-source spectrum analyzer implementation for Xilinx RFSoC devices using the PYNQ framework. It provides interactive visualization and analysis of radio frequency spectrums.

name: literate-calc-mode
one_line_profile: Literate programming mode for Emacs Calc
detailed_description: An Emacs mode that enables literate programming for the Emacs Calculator. It allows users to write documents where calculations are embedded and executed, facilitating reproducible calculation reports.

name: surveydown
one_line_profile: Markdown-based programmable survey generation using R and Quarto
detailed_description: A tool for designing and deploying surveys using Markdown, R, and Quarto. It allows researchers to create reproducible, programmable data collection instruments integrated with the scientific R ecosystem.

name: nb_pdf_template
one_line_profile: LaTeX template for accurate Jupyter Notebook to PDF conversion
detailed_description: A template for nbconvert that improves the PDF output of Jupyter Notebooks, ensuring that scientific reports generated from notebooks are properly formatted and readable.

name: papyrus
one_line_profile: Literate programming tool for Common Lisp and Markdown/Org-mode
detailed_description: A tool that enables literate programming by combining Common Lisp with Markdown or Org-mode. It facilitates the creation of executable documentation and reports for Lisp-based scientific workflows.

name: ttnn-visualizer
one_line_profile: Visualization tool for Tenstorrent AI model execution and tensors
detailed_description: A comprehensive tool for visualizing and analyzing the execution of AI models on Tenstorrent hardware. It provides interactive graphs, memory plots, and tensor details, aiding in the analysis and optimization of scientific AI models.

name: present
one_line_profile: Script interpolation engine for Markdown documents
detailed_description: A tool that executes code blocks within Markdown documents and interpolates the output back into the document. It serves as a language-agnostic engine for literate programming and reproducible report generation.

name: jupyterlab-nbconvert-nocode
one_line_profile: JupyterLab extension to export notebooks to PDF/HTML without code cells
detailed_description: A helper library and JupyterLab extension that provides NBConvert exporters for generating clean reports (PDF/HTML) from Jupyter notebooks by automatically stripping out code cells, facilitating scientific reporting and communication.

name: notestar
one_line_profile: Reproducible notebook system based on R targets package
detailed_description: A notebook system for R that integrates with the 'targets' pipeline package, enabling researchers to create reproducible laboratory notes and reports where dependencies and computations are managed automatically.

name: jupyterlab_powerpoint
one_line_profile: Convert Jupyter Notebooks to PowerPoint presentations
detailed_description: A JupyterLab extension that allows users to generate Microsoft PowerPoint presentations directly from Jupyter Notebooks, streamlining the process of creating scientific presentations from data analysis code.

name: paperboy
one_line_profile: Web frontend for scheduling and distributing Jupyter notebook reports
detailed_description: A production-grade application for scheduling, executing, and distributing Jupyter Notebooks as reports. It allows users to parameterize notebooks and run them on a schedule, generating reports for scientific or data analysis monitoring.

name: open-data-scientist
one_line_profile: AI agent for automated data analysis and report generation
detailed_description: An AI-driven data scientist agent utilizing the ReAct framework to automate complex data analysis tasks. It can execute Python code, process datasets, and generate detailed analytical reports, serving as an assistant for scientific data exploration.

name: nbrun
one_line_profile: Tool to automate execution of Jupyter Notebooks
detailed_description: A utility to automate the execution of Jupyter Notebooks from within other notebooks or scripts, facilitating the creation of chained analysis workflows and reproducible scientific pipelines.

name: LibKGE
one_line_profile: Knowledge graph embedding library for reproducible research
detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library for training, evaluating, and analyzing knowledge graph embeddings (KGE). It emphasizes reproducibility and hyperparameter optimization, widely used in scientific knowledge representation and link prediction tasks.

name: lab.note
one_line_profile: R Markdown templates for laboratory notes and reports
detailed_description: An R package providing templates and utilities for creating structured laboratory notes and research reports using R Markdown, designed to support documentation in scientific workflows.

name: sos-papermill
one_line_profile: Batch executor for SoS (Script of Scripts) notebooks
detailed_description: An extension of the Papermill tool designed for SoS (Script of Scripts) notebooks, enabling the parameterized execution and batch processing of polyglot scientific notebooks (supporting multiple languages like Python, R, Julia in one file).

name: xaringan
one_line_profile: R package for creating reproducible HTML5 presentations
detailed_description: An R package that provides an R Markdown extension based on remark.js to create HTML5 presentations. It enables researchers to embed R code, execution results, and scientific visualizations directly into slides, supporting the workflow of reproducible research and scientific communication.
